description: Third-party verification of checkpoint chain without decryption
steps: Anyone can verify checkpoint authenticity WITHOUT reading contents.
- resurrectFromCID: if this follows a resurrection
- signature: Ed25519 sig over encrypted payload
2. Derive public key from AID (Base64URL decode)
4. If valid: checkpoint is authentic (owner signed it)
Output: { valid: true, aid, timestamp, previousCID, chainLength }
WHAT CANNOT BE VERIFIED WITHOUT KEY:
- Whether contents are 'correct' (only that owner signed them)
Walks previousCID links, verifies each signature
Reports parentAID chain up to root (parentAID = null)
Verify: Can verify signature without private key
Verify: Chain walk stops at genesis (previousCID = null)
Verify: Invalid signature returns valid: false
